Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Brevinin-1PMa (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a; more AMPs? Ranatuerin-2PMa; Ranatuerin-2PMb; Ranatuerin-2PMc; Ranatuerin-2PMd)
Sequence Information.Source: the Amazon River frog,Lithobates palmipes(Ranidae), South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (95.83%) toBrevinin-1BLbA=K: 17%; I=L: 13%. GRAVY: 1.29; Mol Wt:  2531.245; Mol formula: C121H204N28O26S2; mol ex coeff: 125.Discovery: isolated from frog skin secretions.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 35218 (MIC 50 uM), S. aureus ATCC 12600 (MIC 3.13 uM), and E. faecium ATCC 19434 (MIC 6.25 uM).In vitro toxicity: female murine RBC: HC50 4 uM, highly hemolytic.Ranatuerin-2PMa; Ranatuerin-2PMb; Ranatuerin-2PMc; Ranatuerin-2PMd: antimicrobial activity not tested. Est. 3/2023
Literature Information.Author: Mechkarska M, Barran G, Kolodziejek J, Coquet L, Leprince J, Jouenne T, Nowotny N, Conlon JM. 2023
Literature Information.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol Part D Genomics Proteomics. 2023 Feb 24;46:101069. doi: 10.1016/j.cbd.2023.101069.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Peptidomic analysis of the host-defense peptides in skin secretions of the Amazon River frog Lithobates palmipes (Ranidae).
